title: Angkor
summary: Angkor (Khmer: អង្គរ pronounced [ʔɑŋ.ˈkɔː], lit. capital city), also known as Yasodharapura (Khmer: យសោធរបុរៈ; Sanskrit: यशोधरपुर)[1][2] was the capital city of the Khmer Empire. The city and empire flourished from approximately the 9th to the 15th centuries. The city houses the magnificent Angkor Wat, one of Cambodia's most popular tourist attractions.
